turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You know, there is a charity called Save the Children.  It's a great charity and supports kids.  Even a few cents helps.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi, yeah I have heard about this charity and will be considering making a donation to them.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's great! Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief, and helps support children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I was thinking about making a donation of about 30 cents to the organization.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That would be great.  Right now, there is still a lot to do in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria and small donations will help a lot of children and their families. We all have a responsibility to help.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I agree it is doing gods work and makes a difference to make even a small donation to them.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: How much money do you spend on unnecessary things like snacks or candy? Money can be used in more meaningful ways.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: only about 5-10 dollars per two weeks. I am more of a healthy eater. I have to watch my diet too.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Every little bit helps, but for the price of a dollar a day, you can sponsor a Save the Children child in need in the US or abroad.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I agree, money should be used for more important issues.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children is a reputable organization; more than 90% of their money goes towards the children they are helping, so you can also be confident that your money is going where it should.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: i heard that they are very legitimate. I am definitely making a donation to help them of 0.30 cents.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That sounds great! The organization helped more than 157 million kids last year and your donation will help one of them. Do you know how to donate?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: sure do. I plan on making the donation after this study is completed.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: OK.  Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment, and you can choose any amount, all the way up to $2, if you want to donate more than 30 cents.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: yeah I I know I can. I might consider also making a larger donation to 0.50 cents. but I think 0.30 cents is adequate to help out some of the children.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, anything helps. The research team will collect all of the donations and send them to Save the Children.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: ok. that sounds legitimate to me. I want to help children and make my money go to good use.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Small donations will help a lot of childrens and their families and your donation will certainly help.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: any means to be helpful and make a difference in others lives is what I care about the most.
